meanings.sent1: The frowziest room in the house was filled with old, dusty furniture.
meanings.sent2: She wore her frowziest sweater to the casual gathering.
meanings.sent3: The frowziest cat in the neighborhood always seemed to find the coziest spots to nap.
meanings.sent4: The frowziest corner of the attic held forgotten treasures from years past.
meanings.sent5: The frowziest smell of old books and mildew lingered in the abandoned library.

meanings.definition: Frowziest: having a musty or stale smell
meanings.sent1: The basement had the frowziest odor of dampness and neglect.
meanings.sent2: After being closed for months, the room had a frowziest scent that needed fresh air.
meanings.sent3: The frowziest aroma of old cheese and socks wafted from the teenager's room.
meanings.sent4: The frowziest stench of decay hung in the air of the forgotten cellar.
meanings.sent5: The frowziest whiff of old newspapers and dust greeted visitors to the attic.

meanings.definition: Frowziest: untidy or unkempt in appearance
meanings.sent1: His frowziest hair stuck out in all directions after a long day of play.
meanings.sent2: The frowziest garden on the block was overgrown with weeds and wildflowers.
meanings.sent3: The frowziest scarecrow in the field had birds perched on its messy hat.
meanings.sent4: The frowziest pile of laundry lay neglected in the corner of the room.
meanings.sent5: The frowziest appearance of the old scarecrow made it seem almost alive in the moonlight.
